Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2014 04:46AM Salina888 wrote: NSwrites- I had a lump for years, and Doctor had mammograms every 6 months  for about 2 years to make sure there was no change in size, then they told me it looks negative, and to come back next year.  By the time next year came around I noticed the lump was getting bigger, and was beginning to have a little indent.  They did a biopsy and said it was cancer.  I suggest after mammogram and ultrasound get a biopsy to be sure.  I could have caught this 3 years earlier.  I asked Doc after diagnosis why they didn't do a biopsy right away.  Her response was there was no family history, and I was kind of young. (39 at the time) I asked if the mammogram can detect cancer, she said it primary used to detect lumps, which I pointed out 3 years prior.  One doctor told me that she trust an ultrasound more then mammogram.  I tell all my friends to get a biopsy to be sure.  Google for me was very educational, but this site is really good too.
Posts.Title: Wishing I had more answers... NSwrites juliaanna

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2014 11:28PM Salina888 wrote: janet- Knowing what I know now, I would have definately asked for a biopsy, that's why I tell all my friends just do it.  A biopsy would really put your mind at ease.  I think some doctors don't want to put their patients in pain, and figure they can watch to see if it grows because a large % of biopsy do come back negative.
Posts.Title: Wishing I had more answers... NSwrites juliaanna
